trans-unit.source: Writing LINQ Queries Against the Table Service
trans-unit.target: Writing LINQ Queries Against the Table Service

trans-unit.source: You can write queries against the Table service using LINQ syntax.
trans-unit.target: You can write queries against the Table service using LINQ syntax.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to write sample queries similar to the sample queries shown in <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link>, but using LINQ instead of the REST protocol.
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to write sample queries similar to the sample queries shown in <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link>, but using LINQ instead of the REST protocol.

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports executing simple queries that retrieve all properties of an entity; it's not possible to select a subset of an entity's properties.
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports executing simple queries that retrieve all properties of an entity; it's not possible to select a subset of an entity's properties.

trans-unit.source: The Table service also supports filtering query results using the <languageKeyword>Where</languageKeyword> operator, and specifying how many entities to return using the <languageKeyword>Take</languageKeyword> operator.
trans-unit.target: The Table service also supports filtering query results using the <languageKeyword>Where</languageKeyword> operator, and specifying how many entities to return using the <languageKeyword>Take</languageKeyword> operator.

trans-unit.source: For details about which LINQ operators are supported by the Table service, see <link xlink:href="de258a1e-4101-4443-88cb-f9d156f04246" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Operators (Table Storage Support)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about which LINQ operators are supported by the Table service, see <link xlink:href="de258a1e-4101-4443-88cb-f9d156f04246" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Operators (Table Storage Support)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Projecting Entity Properties
trans-unit.target: Projecting Entity Properties

trans-unit.source: The LINQ <languageKeyword>select</languageKeyword> clause can be used to project a subset of properties from an entity or entities.
trans-unit.target: The LINQ <languageKeyword>select</languageKeyword> clause can be used to project a subset of properties from an entity or entities.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of properties that can be projected is 255, which is also the maximum number of properties in an entity.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of properties that can be projected is 255, which is also the maximum number of properties in an entity.

trans-unit.source: To project an entity’s properties, the client must support OData Data Service Version 2.0, indicated by specifying either the <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference> headers as follows:
trans-unit.target: To project an entity’s properties, the client must support OData Data Service Version 2.0, indicated by specifying either the <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference> headers as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how to project properties from a single entity, using the required object initializer:
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how to project properties from a single entity, using the required object initializer:

trans-unit.source: The following example projects 3 properties from an entity that has 10 properties.
trans-unit.target: The following example projects 3 properties from an entity that has 10 properties.

trans-unit.source: In this example, <codeInline>SampleEntity</codeInline>’s 10 properties are letters from A through J:
trans-unit.target: In this example, <codeInline>SampleEntity</codeInline>’s 10 properties are letters from A through J:

trans-unit.source: Single entity projection is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Single entity projection is not supported.

trans-unit.source: The REST request produced by the following code is invalid:
trans-unit.target: The REST request produced by the following code is invalid:

trans-unit.source: You can also project entity properties by using the <system>$select</system> query option in a standard REST request.
trans-unit.target: You can also project entity properties by using the <system>$select</system> query option in a standard REST request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on entity projections and transformations, see <externalLink><linkText>Select System Query Option ($select)</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink> in the OData documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information on entity projections and transformations, see <externalLink><linkText>Select System Query Option ($select)</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink> in the OData documentation.

trans-unit.source: Returning the Top n Entities
trans-unit.target: Returning the Top n Entities

trans-unit.source: To return <parameterReference>n</parameterReference> entities, use the LINQ <languageKeyword>Take</languageKeyword> operator.
trans-unit.target: To return <parameterReference>n</parameterReference> entities, use the LINQ <languageKeyword>Take</languageKeyword> operator.

trans-unit.source: Note that the maximum number of entities that may be returned in a single query is 1,000.
trans-unit.target: Note that the maximum number of entities that may be returned in a single query is 1,000.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a value greater than 1,000 for the <languageKeyword>Take</languageKeyword> operator results in error code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: Specifying a value greater than 1,000 for the <languageKeyword>Take</languageKeyword> operator results in error code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: The following example returns the top 10 entities from a Customers table:
trans-unit.target: The following example returns the top 10 entities from a Customers table:
